title: Bi-Weekly Food and Recipes Thread
selftext:
Foodies of r/India! Tried out a new dish? Experimented with cooking yourself and lived to tell the story? Share here!

Feel free to share recipes, and if you tried out something new, you can also share pictures!

**The Food Thread is posted every two weeks on Friday mornings.**

https://preview.redd.it/tti3fyiqw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=899972afbc4bab665798a0f5917960a98ec4f4d5
comments: Which oil do you guys use for cooking and why?

mustard or soy, it's cheaper when i buy 15L tin

i am trying something these days, i make some makhan everyday to replace the cooking oil.

I am a cheapskate for certain things, i enjoy it, so i buy 1.5 L of milk everyday when i am by myself, 500 ml of it is full cream and other is double skimmed and costs me 68 rs .

I get around almost half a small katori of Makhan from it daily which is enough for me.

Did you cook or eat any interesting vegetable dishes (sukkas, curries, saag, etc.) recently? 

Recently in Belgaum (North Karnataka) I ate some incredible sprouted moong. It was really simple, just sprouts in some water, but for some reason it was better than any moong dish I’ve ever had. 

I don’t know what else they put in it, but it had me licking the plate
Always olive oil except for frying.
15l tin of soy oil? How much cost? From where? More details please.

There is hafed manufacturing plant near mu house, they sell it 15 l tins of musturd, refined soy bean oil, etc.

I bought musturd tin last year for around 1800 something

Cocoa and cacao Powder is adulterated by adding sand, online local unknown brand sellers use this shitty technique a lot, bastards.

I stick with Hersey now
Sesame or olive oil. Soy or rice bran for deep frying.
Has anyone here had Birria (pork/ beef/ lamb) taco before? Because it's amazing and so in sync with Indian palate

Protip for eating more veggies. Don’t be elaborate . Chop & assemble veggies you want to eat . Add copious amount of chopped greens as well . Olive oil, grated garlic , pepper , salt . Microwave . If done correctly, it takes 8/10 minutes end to end .
sunflower when cooking, olive oil for dressing

All plants seemingly have a ‘Scientific name’. The Sunflower is no different. They’re called Helianthus. Helia meaning sun and Anthus meaning Flower. Contrary to popular belief, this doesn’t refer to the look of the sunflower, but the solar tracking it displays every dayy during most of its growth period.

I am a super lazy bastard that has been cooking his own meal for the past year. and managed to lose 18 kgs of weight in that time. 

Lentil salads and boiled eggs ftw. also replaced wheat/rice with oats/quinoa
toh main kya karu, job chhod du?
